# Mariyappan Thangavelu

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

Mariyappan Thangavelu [![Mariyappan
Thangavelu.jpg](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f4/Mariyappan_Thangavelu.jpg)](/wiki/File:Mariyappan_Thangavelu.jpg)  
---  
Personal information  
Full name |  Mariyappan Thangavelu மாரியப்பன் தங்கவேலு  
Born | (1995-06-28) 28 June 1995 (age 22)  
Periavadagampatti, [Salem district](/wiki/Salem_district "Salem district"),
[Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu "Tamil Nadu"), India  
Sport  
Country | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png) [India](/wiki/India "India")  
Sport | Athletics  
Event(s) | High Jump - T42  
Achievements and titles  
[Paralympic finals](/wiki/Paralympic_Games "Paralympic Games") | **[2016 Summer Paralympics](/wiki/2016_Summer_Paralympics "2016 Summer Paralympics")** : High Jump (T42) – Gold  
Medal record[hide] |   
---  
Representing
![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-
Flag_of_India.svg.png) [India](/wiki/India "India")  
Men's athletics  
[Paralympic Games](/wiki/Paralympic_Games "Paralympic Games")  
![Gold medal – first place](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d5/Gold_medal_icon_%28G_initial%29.svg/16px-Gold_medal_icon_%28G_initial%29.svg.png) | [2016 Rio Paralympics](/wiki/2016_Summer_Paralympics "2016 Summer Paralympics") | [High Jump (T42)](/wiki/Athletics_at_the_2016_Summer_Paralympics "Athletics at the 2016 Summer Paralympics")  
  
**Mariyappan Thangavelu** (born 28 June 1995)[1] is an [Indian](/wiki/India
"India") [**Paralympic**](/wiki/Paralympic_Games "Paralympic Games") [high
jumper](/wiki/High_Jump "High Jump"). He represented India in the [2016 Summer
Paralympic games](/wiki/2016_Summer_Paralympics "2016 Summer Paralympics")
held in [Rio de Janeiro](/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro "Rio de Janeiro") in the [men's
high jump T-42 category](/wiki/Athletics_at_the_2016_Summer_Paralympics
"Athletics at the 2016 Summer Paralympics"), winning the gold medal in the
finals.[2][3] He is India's first Paralympian gold medallist since 2004.
[Tamil film](/wiki/Tamil_cinema "Tamil cinema") director [Aishwaryaa
Dhanush](/wiki/Aishwarya_R._Dhanush "Aishwarya R. Dhanush") is making a film
about this life and achievements titled [Mariyappan](/wiki/Mariyappan_\(film\)
"Mariyappan \(film\)").[4]

On 25 January 2017, Government of India announced "Padma Shri" award for his
contribution towards sports[5] and in the same year he was also awarded
[Arjuna Award](/wiki/Arjuna_Award "Arjuna Award").[6]

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 Early life
  * 2 Athletic career
  * 3 Personal life
  * 4 Awards and recognition
  * 5 See also
  * 6 References

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mariyappan_Thangavelu&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Mariyappan was born in Periavadagampatti village, [Salem
district](/wiki/Salem_district "Salem district"), [Tamil
Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu "Tamil Nadu"), one of six children (four brothers and a
sister). His father reportedly abandoned the family early on, and his mother,
Saroja, raised her children as a single mother, carrying bricks as a labourer
until becoming a vegetable seller, earning ₹100 (US$1.60) a day.[3] At the age
of five, Mariyappan suffered permanent disability in his right leg when he was
run over by a drunk bus driver while walking to school; the bus crushed his
leg below the knee, causing it to become stunted.[7] Despite this setback, he
completed secondary schooling; he says he "didn't see myself as different from
able-bodied kids."[3]

## Athletic
career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mariyappan_Thangavelu&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Athletic career")]

Mariyappan enjoyed playing volleyball as a student; subsequently, his school
physical education instructor encouraged him to try high jumping. In his first
competitive event, aged 14, he placed second among a field of able-bodied
competitors, after which he received strong encouragement from his classmates
and others in [Salem district](/wiki/Salem_district "Salem district"). In
2013, his current coach Mr.Satyanarayana, supported by the Sports academy of
India for differently-abled, first noticed his performance at the Indian
national para-athletics championships, and formally took him on as a student
in 2015, bringing him to [Bengaluru](/wiki/Bangalore "Bangalore") for further
coaching.[7]

In March 2016, Mariyappan cleared a distance of 1.78 m (5 ft 10 in) in the
men's high jump T–42 event at the IPC Grand Prix in [Tunisia](/wiki/Tunisia
"Tunisia"), qualifying him for the [Rio Paralympics](/wiki/Rio_Paralympics
"Rio Paralympics").[7] At the [Rio Paralympics](/wiki/Rio_Paralympics "Rio
Paralympics"), he won the gold medal in the [men's high jump T–42
event](/wiki/Athletics_at_the_2016_Summer_Paralympics "Athletics at the 2016
Summer Paralympics"), with a leap of 1.89 m (6 ft 2 in).[8]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mariyappan_Thangavelu&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

In 2015, Mariyappan completed a bachelor's degree in business administration
from AVS College of Arts and Science. He plans to complete an MBA from the
same institution.[8]

He has an elder sister Sudha and two younger brothers Kumar and Gopi.[8]

## Awards and
recognition[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mariyappan_Thangavelu&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Awards and recognition")]

For the gold medal at the 2016 Summer Paralympics

  * [Padma Shri](/wiki/Padma_Shri "Padma Shri") (2017) - fourth highest Indian national honour[9]
  * ₹2 crore (US$310,000) from the [Government of Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Government_of_Tamil_Nadu "Government of Tamil Nadu")[10]
  * ₹75 lakh (US$120,000) from the [Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports](/wiki/Ministry_of_Youth_Affairs_and_Sports "Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports")[10]
  * ₹30 lakh (US$47,000) from the [Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment](/wiki/Ministry_of_Social_Justice_and_Empowerment "Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment")[11]
  * ₹15 lakh (US$23,000) from fund established by [Sachin Tendulkar](/wiki/Sachin_Tendulkar "Sachin Tendulkar"), various corporations.[12]
  * ₹10 lakh (US$16,000) from [Yash Raj Films](/wiki/Yash_Raj_Films "Yash Raj Films")[13]
  * ₹10 lakh (US$16,000) from the Delhi Golf Club[14]
  * ₹5 lakh (US$7,800) from NRI businessman Mukkattu Sebastian[15]

## See
also[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mariyappan_Thangavelu&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: See also")]

  * [Sharad Kumar](/wiki/Sharad_Kumar_\(athlete\) "Sharad Kumar \(athlete\)"), [P.V.Sindhu](/wiki/P._V._Sindhu "P. V. Sindhu")

qa.question: who won gold medal in rio paralympics in high jump

nq_14739_10.Query Analysis: The query seeks to identify the individual who won the gold medal in the high jump event at the Rio Paralympics.
nq_14739_10.Query Keywords Extraction: gold medal, Rio Paralympics, high jump, winner
nq_14739_10.Answer Analysis: The answer indicates that Mariyappan Thangavelu won the gold medal in the men's high jump event at the Rio Paralympics.
nq_14739_10.Document Content Analysis: The document contains references to articles and announcements related to Mariyappan Thangavelu's achievement in the Rio Paralympics, specifically mentioning his gold medal win in the men's high jump event and subsequent awards and recognitions.
nq_14739_10.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document includes keywords such as 'Mariyappan Thangavelu', 'gold', 'Paralympics', and 'high jump'.
nq_14739_10.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document directly mentions 'Mariyappan Thangavelu', which matches the answer provided.
nq_14739_10.Key Information Matching: The document explicitly states that Mariyappan Thangavelu won the gold medal in the men's high jump at the Rio Paralympics, directly matching the key information required by the query.
nq_14739_10.Can the Document Answer the Query: Yes, the document directly answers the query by stating that Mariyappan Thangavelu won the gold medal in the high jump event.
nq_14739_10.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: Yes, the document provides additional context about the recognition and awards received by Mariyappan Thangavelu following his victory.
nq_14739_10.Explanation: The document is directly related to the query as it explicitly mentions Mariyappan Thangavelu's gold medal win in the high jump event at the Rio Paralympics. It provides substantial useful context and additional information that enhances understanding of the query's topic.
